labels.analysis: The MCP Server described provides comprehensive access and management of HubSpot CRM data through a wide range of API tools. Its core functionality revolves around CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete) for various CRM entities such as companies, contacts, leads, and products. It also supports advanced features like batch processing, association handling between objects, communication management, and meeting/engagement tracking. The server simplifies integration with HubSpot CRM by offering type-safe validation and extensive support for different CRM entities, making it an essential tool for managing customer relationship operations programmatically.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Database Operations" was chosen because the server primarily facilitates querying, managing, and manipulating HubSpot CRM data, which can be considered a specialized database. Secondary labels "API Integration" and "Daily Productivity" were selected because the server heavily relies on API interactions to manage CRM data and supports productivity-related features like contact and task management. A custom label wasn't deemed necessary as the existing labels adequately cover the server's functionality.

tools.description: Create a batch of products

tools.name: products_batch_read
tools.description: Read a batch of products by internal ID, or unique property values. Retrieve records by the `idProperty` parameter to retrieve records by a custom unique value property.

tools.description: Update a batch of products by internal ID, or unique values specified by the `idProperty` query param.

tools.name: products_list
tools.description: Read a page of products. Control what is returned via the `properties` query param. `after` is the paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

tools.name: products_read
tools.description: Read an Object identified by ID

tools.name: products_create
tools.description: Create a product with the given properties and return a copy of the object, including the ID.

tools.name: products_update
tools.description: Perform a partial update of an Object identified by ID. Read-only and non-existent properties will result in an error. Properties values can be cleared by passing an empty string.

tools.name: products_archive
tools.description: Move an Object identified by ID to the recycling bin.

tools.name: products_search
tools.description: Search products

server_info_crawled.name: HubSpot CRM API Server
server_info_crawled.author: @BlackSand-Software/hubspot-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide standardized access and management of HubSpot CRM data through a comprehensive MCP server. Enable efficient CRM operations including object management, advanced search, batch processing, and association handling. Simplify integration with type-safe validation and extensive support for CRM entities like companies, contacts, deals, and communications.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@BlackSand-Software/hubspot-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: HUBSPOT_ACCESS_TOKEN
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: HUBSPOT_ACCESS_TOKEN - Your HubSpot API access token
